Federal prosecutors in New York on Monday announced charges against the creators of software called Blackshades that hackers around the world allegedly used to hijack hundreds of thousands of computers , allowing them to spy on victims through computer webcams and steal financial information .

RelatedSentence: Federal prosecutors in New York on Monday announced charges against the creators of software called Blackshades that hackers around the world allegedly used to hijack hundreds of thousands of computers , allowing them to spy on victims through computer webcams and steal financial information .

In recent days , the Federal Bureau of Investigation and foreign police agencies launched a series of raids in 19 countries , arresting more than 90 people who had purchased the software from the Blackshades website for $ 40 .

The software is what experts call a RAT , or remote access tool , that allows people to control computers from a distance .
The software is what experts call a RAT , or remote access tool , that allows people to control computers from a distance .

We now live in a world where , for just $ 40 , a cybercriminal halfway across the globe can -- with just a click of a mouse -- unleash a RAT that can spread a computer plague not only on someone 's property , but also on their privacy and most personal spaces , said U.S. Attorney Preet Bharara , at a news conference Monday .
His Manhattan - based office is prosecuting the case .
The Justice Department is seeking his extradition on two counts of computer hacking , each of which carries a punishment of as many as 10 years in prison .
The Justice Department is seeking his extradition on two counts of computer hacking , each of which carries a punishment of as many as 10 years in prison .
Mr. Hogue , who was arrested in Arizona in June 2012 as part of a separate cybercrime operation , has been cooperating with investigators in the Blackshades probe , according to court documents .
He pleaded guilty in January 2013 to two counts of hacking in the other case .
A lawyer for Mr. Hogue did n't immediately respond to requests for comment .
Blackshades customers captured computers by tricking victims into clicking on email links and drawing users to websites laden with malware , the FBI agents said in court documents .

Prosecutors announced charges against several other men as well .

The government obtained a warrant to search an email account Mr. Yucel used to communicate with Blackshades employees , which led them to individuals who had allegedly purchased the software , including Kyle Fedorek of Stoney Pont , N.Y. , whom prosecutors say allegedly used Blackshades to glean credit card and financial accounts numbers from at least 400 victims .

Marlen Rappa , of Middletown Township , N.J. , allegedly used Blackshades to spy on and secretly capture images of at least 45 victims through their computers ' web cameras and to steal electronic videos and photographs , from approximately 95 victim computers -- some of them sexually explicit , according to court documents .
